intro: Peucedanum candollei, commonly known as the Candolle's angelica, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It is often found in rocky or alpine habitats and is characterized by its strong, spicy scent. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
